business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open lower but IT stocks rallyThe S&P BSE added 42.49 points to 83,319.64, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.05 points to 25,665.70 as of 10:10 am.

Global tech giants see billions erased amid rising AI cost concernsInvestors who once rewarded bold AI plans are now asking tougher questions about spending, profits and competition. Several of the largest US technology firms have lost hundreds of billions of dollars in market value since the start of 2026.

India–US trade deal advances with focus on finalising legal agreementSpeaking on the development, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal said a joint statement outlining the contours of the agreement has already been signed. He said that these contours now need to be converted into a formal legal agreement.

Record MSP procurement: How many farmers are actually benefiting?India's MSP system is clearly expanding, with higher spending, larger procurement and more beneficiaries than before. Yet the debate has shifted from scale to security.
Sensex rallies over 600 points: Why stock market rose today?The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 650.39 points to close at 83,277.15, while the NSE Nifty50 added 211.65 points to end at 25,682.75.

How cash levels in mutual funds impact returns during volatile marketsIn the current market, volatility caused by global and external factors has led some mutual funds to increase their cash positions. The idea is to lower risk and protect portfolios from sudden corrections.

Can NPS help you save tax in the new regime? What salaried employees must knowFor salaried workers who have moved to the new tax regime, tax saving can feel limited. This has led many to question if there are still practical ways to ease their tax burden. Let's have a look.

Can your employer refuse gratuity if you get pension? Here's what employees must knowMany employees assume that receiving a pension from their employer means they may have to give up gratuity. But the law draws a clear distinction between the two. A recent court ruling has clarified what workers should know about their rights.

Why Mumbai remains India's top luxury housing hubThe global recognition Mumbai is receiving today is best understood as validation rather than arrival. International research now ranks the city among the world's fastest-growing luxury housing markets, reflecting sustained price appreciation at the very top end.

Using old tax regime? Here's how draft income tax rules 2026 could help you save moreIf you are still using the old income tax regime, the government's draft rules for 2026 may bring some welcome relief. Proposed changes to key exemptions and allowances could slightly lower your tax bill and make the traditional regime more rewarding.

RBI move hits Dalal Street stocks: BSE, Groww fall up to 10%. Here's whyThe selling pressure came after the RBI issued a revised circular on February 13 under its amended RBI (Commercial Banks – Credit Facilities) Directions. The new rules change how banks can lend to entities involved in the capital markets.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as market sentiment remain cautious over IT selloffThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 47.79 points to 82,578.97, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7.45 points to 25,464.75 as of 9:48 am.

Man paid Rs 50,000 a year premium, insurance claim denied when mother fell illThe man said he had been paying nearly Rs 50,000 a year for his mother's policy. But when she required treatment and her son approached Star Health's Lucknow office, he was allegedly made to wait for hours before his claim was denied.

Budget without populism and with capital outlays powers growth, jobs: PMDescribing the Budget for the fiscal year starting April 1 as reflective of his governance approach, PM Modi said the document is a good reflection of our governance style and priorities.

Have Rs 5,000? Here's why an emergency fund should come before your SIPYou've heard the advice, i.e., "Start a SIP immediately." But is that the smartest first move with Rs 5,000? The choice might surprise you.

Will AI change how you invest your money in stocks and mutual funds?The next market shift may not come from earnings or interest rates. It may come from AI. In this article, we explore how it could reshape your stock and mutual fund investments.

Air India fined Rs 1 crore for flying Airbus 8 times without airworthiness permitThe DGCA has imposed a fine of about Rs 1 crore on Air India for flying an Airbus aircraft eight times without a valid airworthiness permit. The aviation watchdog also said the lapse further eroded public trust in the airline.

Why personalised loans are becoming the go-to option in 2026The journey of hyper-personalisation in personal loans is going to get more exciting for customers with the increasing adoption of technology refining customer offerings, based on minute details of the customers.

RBI plans to update Kisan Credit Card rules : 5 key changes to trackThe Reserve Bank of India is preparing to overhaul the Kisan Credit Card scheme, and the proposed changes could reshape how farmers borrow and repay loans. With the new draft rules on the table, what exactly is set to change for farm credit?

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's market bloodbath?The market opened on a weak note and remained under pressure throughout the session, with losses deepening in the second half. The decline appeared to be driven by profit booking at elevated levels and a cautious mood among investors amid global uncertainties.

entertainment.headline: Jazz City: Music meets espionage in 1971 Calcutta during Bangladesh Liberation War SonyLiv's Bengali thriller Jazz City trailer is out, set in politically charged 1971 Calcutta. The series promises a gripping mix of music, mystery and revolution streaming from March 19.

Taapsee Pannu reacts to NEET aspirant's death, slams normalisation of sexual assault Taapsee Pannu strongly condemned the alleged sexual assault and death of a NEET aspirant in Patna. The Assi actor called out society's growing desensitisation to crimes against women.

SZA greets crowd with Namaskaram, chants Shiv Shambhu at Isha Centre. Watch SZA surprised fans by attending Mahashivratri celebrations at the Isha Foundation in Coimbatore, where she chanted "Shiv Shambhu" and joined devotees on stage.

No phones, no celebrities: Vijay-Rashmika plan month-long break after wedding Actors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna will marry in a private ceremony in Udaipur on February 26. The couple has implemented a no-phone policy to avoid leaks.

Amaal Mallik apologises to Baseer Ali after tweet likes row: Sorry for mudslinging Amaal Mallik issued a public apology after liking tweets critical of Baseer Ali, calling it accidental and urging fans to stop online negativity. Actor Kunickaa Sadanand also supported both stars, praising their maturity and calling for positivity among fandoms.

O' Romeo box office Day 4: Shahid Kapoor's best run since Kabir Singh Shahid Kapoor's O' Romeo held steady at the box office, marking his strongest theatrical run since Kabir Singh. The Vishal Bhardwaj directorial showed encouraging weekday stability despite mixed reviews.

Gautham Menon at 25: A celebration of Tamil cinema's most romantic storyteller Filmmaker Gautham Vasudev Menon celebrated 25 years in Tamil cinema with a musical event in Chennai. He announced he'll start a new film soon, adding that the long-awaited Dhruva Natchathiram is set to release despite past financial and legal issues.

Who owns the music? Ilaiyaraaja's copyright battle and the world of royalties Music maestro Ilaiyaraaja's multiple copyright battles often ushered in discussions about music rights and fair pay for all those involved. In this week's Cinematic Saturday, let's discuss in detail about copyrights and royalty in Indian film music.

Composer Anirudh launches music label, to release film songs, indie tracks soon Music composer Anirudh Ravichander has announced the launch of his new audio label, Albuquerque Records. Through the company, he will publish his own works and support emerging artists.

Raveena Tandon on rejecting Kuch Kuch Hota Hai: Couldn't play second lead Raveena Tandon shared why she rejected Kuch Kuch Hota Hai and the song Chaiyya Chaiyya from Dil Se at a crucial stage in her career. The actor said she wanted to re-establish herself as a solo heroine and avoid being typecast as an "item girl.

Ilaiyaraaja barred from using 134 compositions in Saregama copyright case: Court The Delhi High Court has issued an order restraining composer Ilaiyaraaja from using or exploiting musical works and sound recordings from 134 films, following a copyright case filed by audio company Saregama.

How Zeeshan Ayyub's Vinay in Assi dismantles Bollywood's wounded male ego In Assi, Anubhav Sinha rejects Bollywood's familiar revenge template and gives us a husband who refuses to turn his wife's trauma into his battlefield. Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub's Vinay stands beside, not in front of the survivor.

Harry Styles to headline and curate Meltdown Festival 2026 in London Harry Styles will curate and perform at the 2026 Meltdown Festival in London, marking the 75th anniversary of the Southbank Centre.

Ameesha Patel reacts to fresh warrant in Moradabad event case: Old and settled Ameesha Patel has reacted after a Moradabad court issued a non-bailable warrant against her in a 2017 wedding event dispute. The actor called the matter old and settled, alleging false claims and stating that her legal team will take action.

Adam Sandler, Viola Davis and other Hollywood celebs pay tribute to Robert Duvall Hollywood legend Robert Duvall died at 95. Tributes from fellow actors celebrate his unforgettable performances in classics like The Godfather, Apocalypse Now and Tender Mercies.

Robert Duvall, Oscar-winning star of The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, dies at 95 Known for subtle, authentic performances, Robert Duvall emerged as one of cinema's most respected actors. He won the Academy Award for best actor in 1983 for his portrayal of a washed-up country singer in Tender Mercies, a role regarded as a masterclass in understated performance.

Patralekhaa supports husband Rajkummar Rao as his weight gain sparks talk Actor Patralekhaa defends Rajkummar Rao after his weight gain draws online chatter, revealing the intense transformation behind his latest biopic.

HIT director Sailesh Kolanu steps into rom-com space with Emo Emo Idi, first look out Director Sailesh Kolanu takes a creative turn with his first romantic entertainer Emo Emo Idi. The film explores Gen Z love and is set for a Dussehra 2026 release.

Arijit Singh retired because he got tired of singing the same song: Anurag Kashyap Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap reacts to Arijit Singh's retirement announcement, suggesting the singer was weary of repeating the same heartbreak template.

general news.headline: Eyes on PM Modi-Macron Mumbai bilateral, key defence deals in focusPrime Minister Narendra Modi welcomes French President Emmanuel Macron to India. Artificial intelligence and broader strategic cooperation are expected to dominate discussions with Modi, along with a renewed push for defence collaboration, including joint manufacturing of helicopters and HAMMER precision-guided missiles.

Teen was speeding SUV for reels, lost my son due to him: Victim's motherThe mother of a 23-year-old man killed in a Delhi car crash on February 3 alleged that the minor was speeding his SUV while he was busy shooting reels, and that his reckless driving costed his son's life.

Bangladesh's Yunus needles India again with Seven Sisters remark in exit speechUnder Muhammad Yunus, Delhi-Dhaka ties reached their lowest ebb amid a rise in anti-India sentiment. In his farewell speech, Yunus again provoked India by referring to the Seven Sisters while asserting that Bangladesh was no longer a 'submissive' nation. What does his speech imply?

How 2 ex-India coaches planned Australia's downfall in T20 World CupSri Lanka vs Australia: Co-hosts Sri Lanka qualified for the Super 8s by beating Australia in Pallekele. After the game, head coach Sanath Jayasuriya explained how two Indian coaches helped him shape this Sri Lankan side.

Yunus aides looking for a safe exit from Bangladesh? Here's the truthRight after the results of the Bangladesh election were declared on February 13, Faiz Ahmad Taiyeb, a special assistant to Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus, left for Germany. The "surprise departure" brought back the chatter of "safe exits" by Yunus's aides as the BNP takes charge of the government. The fact is that there is no bid for "safe exits".

AI Summit in Delhi opens to huge interest, crowding leads to delays, confusionThe India AI Impact Summit 2026 in Delhi opened to high interest from startups and global tech firms but faced challenges on its first day, including crowd congestion, unclear communication, and exhibitors' frustrations over security procedures.

Shoaib Akhtar's rapid U-turn: Mohsin Naqvi incompetent to good man in 24 hoursT20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar made a quick U-turn on his criticism of PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi after Pakistan's humiliating loss to India. Akhtar said his "incompetent" remark was twisted and Naqvi is "a good guy."

No phones, no celebrities: Vijay-Rashmika plan month-long break after weddingActors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna will marry in a private ceremony in Udaipur on February 26. The couple has implemented a no-phone policy to avoid leaks.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 25 | Agitation Alchemy: Anna's Protests, Politics & Power PlaysTamil Nadu is the graveyard of national political parties. It buried the Congress at its peak then in 1967. The BJP, also at its peak now, has been pregnant with possibilities but has failed to deliver. Never a serious player in the state before the dawn of the Modi-era, the BJP has been humbled in every election since his arrival in 2014 (2019, 2021 and 2024).

Kalli Purie pitches 9-point charter for fair AI use in media at AI Impact SummitSpeaking at the India AI Impact Summit, Kalli Purie, Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief of the India Today Group, noted that use of AI in media should be based on fairness, accountability and reciprocity.

Global tech giants see billions erased amid rising AI cost concernsInvestors who once rewarded bold AI plans are now asking tougher questions about spending, profits and competition. Several of the largest US technology firms have lost hundreds of billions of dollars in market value since the start of 2026.

Sex, murder, occult rituals: Chilling details of Indore MBA student's killingPolice said the accused fled to Maharashtra after the murder, allegedly destroyed the victim's phone and attempted occult rituals in a hotel room to call her soul. The man has been arrested days after the crime and is being interrogated.

How Zeeshan Ayyub's Vinay in Assi dismantles Bollywood's wounded male egoIn Assi, Anubhav Sinha rejects Bollywood's familiar revenge template and gives us a husband who refuses to turn his wife's trauma into his battlefield. Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub's Vinay stands beside, not in front of the survivor.

CBSE Board Exam 2026 Live: Class 10 Math exam to begin shortly, late entry not permittedCBSE Board Exam 2026 Live Updates: The CBSE Board Exam 2026 begins today for both Class 10 and Class 12 students, with over 43 lakh students appearing nationwide. Exams will be held in a single shift from 10:30 am to 1:30 pm, so timely arrival at centres is crucial. Get complete exam day guidelines, last-minute preparation tips, dress code rules, and all essential updates to ensure a smooth and stress-free exam experience. Stay tuned for the latest news and live updates from the CBSE Board Exams 2026.

Bengaluru couple 'forgets' their sleeping child in cab, rescued in an hourThe couple immediately contacted the local police through the emergency helpline and narrated the incident. The police took swift action and ensured the safe return of the kid.

India seizes 3 US-sanctioned ships linked to Iran near Mumbai: ReportThe vessels were intercepted about 100 nautical miles off Mumbai and escorted for investigation, as authorities move to prevent ship-to-ship transfers and curb sanctions evasion in Indian waters.

Why Raveena Tandon called Yami Gautam to apologise after watching DhurandharActor Raveena Tandon has shared her appreciation for Aditya Dhar's film Dhurandhar, featuring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, which released in December 2025. Deeply impressed by the film, she even reached out to actor Yami Gautam to commend her husband's dedication and hard work.

O' Romeo box office Day 4: Shahid Kapoor's best run since Kabir SinghShahid Kapoor's O' Romeo held steady at the box office, marking his strongest theatrical run since Kabir Singh. The Vishal Bhardwaj directorial showed encouraging weekday stability despite mixed reviews.

Man paid Rs 50,000 a year premium, insurance claim denied when mother fell illThe man said he had been paying nearly Rs 50,000 a year for his mother's policy. But when she required treatment and her son approached Star Health's Lucknow office, he was allegedly made to wait for hours before his claim was denied.

Dirty water or needles? Fear in Haryana village after string of hepatitis deathsA sense of dread hangs over Chhainsa village in Haryana, where families say illness has entered almost every home. While the administration hunts for Hepatitis cases, villagers ask why so many fell sick in the first place.

Inside the mind of the man who redefined Indian wedding filmsYou know Vishal Punjabi because of the big celebrity weddings — Deepika Padukone–Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma–Virat Kohli. But this piece goes beyond the star names to unpack the craft and the man behind the camera.

Macron arrives in Mumbai on India visit, AI and defence boost on agendaFrench President Emmanuel Macron's visit, scheduled from February 17 to 19, is at the invitation of Modi and includes participation in the AI Impact Summit as well as a bilateral summit in Mumbai. This is Macron's fourth visit to India and his first to Mumbai.

Not the same woman: Conspiracy theories explode over Ghislaine Maxwell prison videoA prison deposition video of Ghislaine Maxwell has sparked widespread online rumours of a body double. Screenshots quickly spread across social media, prompting side-by-side comparisons with older photographs and claims of differences in her appearance.

ICE detains Indian man in child sex assault case, moves to deport himICE has detained an Indian national in New Jersey over alleged sexual assault of a child under 13, along with larceny and public disorder charges, and initiated deportation proceedings.

sports.headline: Abhishek Sharma, just take a single first: Gavaskar's advice to India opener T20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar offered simple advice to Abhishek Sharma amid his tough start to the T20 World Cup. The former captain urged him to get off the mark first before unleashing his attacking game.

Did Pakistan players wait to shake hands with India after Colombo defeat? India defeated Pakistan by 61 runs in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 fixture. The Men in Blue maintained their no handshake policy against the arch-rivals.

Shoaib Akhtar's rapid U-turn: Mohsin Naqvi incompetent to good man in 24 hours T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar made a quick U-turn on his criticism of PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi after Pakistan's humiliating loss to India. Akhtar said his "incompetent" remark was twisted and Naqvi is "a good guy."

Smriti Mandhana named Indian sportswoman of the year Smriti Mandhana was named BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year after a standout 2025 season. The opener starred in India's Women's World Cup triumph and also won another WPL title with RCB.

Jose Mourinho's Benfica not banking on miracles against a wounded Real Madrid Jose Mourinho says Real Madrid are a wounded king ahead of their Champions League clash with Benfica and insists his side need near perfection, not a miracle, to advance.

How Sri Lanka learned from Australia's mistakes to secure Super 8 spot T20 World Cup 2026: Pathum Nissanka said Sri Lanka knew Australia were 20 runs short, planned a calm 12-over approach and executed perfectly to seal an eight-wicket win and Super 8 spot.

How can Australia seal Super 8 spot after shock Sri Lanka defeat? T20 World Cup 2026: Australia's Super 8 hopes hang by a thread after Sri Lanka's win, with Mitchell Marsh admitting they now need "the luck of the Irish" to stay alive.

How 2 ex-India coaches planned Australia's downfall in T20 World Cup Sri Lanka vs Australia: Co-hosts Sri Lanka qualified for the Super 8s by beating Australia in Pallekele. After the game, head coach Sanath Jayasuriya explained how two Indian coaches helped him shape this Sri Lankan side.

Matchday Preview: New Zealand hunt Super 8 spot, AFG stare at knockout ICC T20 World Cup: It is time for Matchday 11 in the T20 World Cup 2026. A couple of big games will decide the fate of the two very important teams in Group B and D.

Kohli would never give up: Dinesh Karthik rips into Babar Azam, ends GOAT debate Dinesh Karthik reignited the Kohli vs Babar debate after Pakistan's loss, calling Babar's shot "submission" and saying Virat Kohli would never give up under pressure.

Match vs AUS one of Sri Lanka's best performances in recent past: Shanaka T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka beat Australia in the T20 World Cup to qualify for the Super 8s. After the win, captain Dasun Shanaka called the game one of Sri Lanka's finest in the recent past.

Nissanka's Pallekele century floors Australia, ex-champs stare at early exitT20 World Cup 2026: Pathum Nissanka's blazing century powered Sri Lanka to an eight-wicket win over Australia, sealing a Super 8 berth and ending a three-year wait for victory over the Aussies in the shortest format.

Vaibhav Sooryavanshi skips Class 10 Board exams, joins RR for IPL 2026India's teenage cricket sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi will not appear for his Class 10 board exams this year. His focus remains on IPL 2026 preparations after a stellar U19 World Cup performance.

Suryakumar Yadav, Kuldeep Yadav patch up after on-ground spat in Colombo: WatchT20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav and Kuldeep Yadav made up after their on-field spat during India's win over Pakistan, sharing a light-hearted video to show there is no rift in the camp.

India had enough runs to enforce follow-on vs Pakistan: R AshwinIND vs PAK: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin joked that India could have followed-on Pakistan in Colombo on Sunday. Ashwin's comments come after the India vs Pakistan match, where the Suryakumar Yadav side beat Pakistan by 61 runs.

England outlast resilient Italy to book Super 8 spot with win by 24 runs in KolkataENG vs ITA, T20 World Cup: England held their nerve to defeat spirited Italy by 24 runs at Eden Gardens, booking their Super 8 berth despite Ben Manenti's breathtaking 60, threatening a major upset in Kolkata.

Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi faces axe after humiliating defeat against India: ReportIND vs PAK, T20 World Cup: It seems like the Pakistan management has had enough of Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi following their poor displays against India with the management reportedly set to drop the star duo in their upcoming game against Namibia.

Rashid Khan scripts history, becomes first bowler to take 700 T20 wicketsAfghanistan captain Rashid Khan became the first cricketer to claim 700 wickets in T20 cricket. His record-breaking feat helped Afghanistan secure a five-wicket win over UAE in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 group stage.

Abhishek Sharma will bounce back: Harbhajan backs batter after duck vs PAKT20 World Cup: Harbhajan Singh backed Abhishek Sharma to bounce back after two ducks in the T20 World Cup, including a four-ball duck vs Pakistan. The former spinner said Abhishek will deliver when India need him most.

All-round Azmat helps Afghanistan beat UAE, remain in Super 8s raceT20 World Cup: Azmatullah Omarzai's all-round brilliance has powered Afghanistan to a five-wicket win over UAE in New Delhi to remain in the race to reach the Super 8 stage of the T20 World Cup 2026.

New Zealand women start new era as Amelia Kerr appointed as all-format captainThe New Zealand women's team will usher in a new era as Amelia Kerr has been appointed as the new all-format captain of the side on Monday, February 16. Kerr takes over from Sophie Devine as the new skipper of the White Ferns.

Suryakumar Yadav asked teammates not to sledge Pakistan, BCCI releases BTS videoIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav instructed his team to avoid sledging during their T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan. The disciplined approach helped India secure a commanding 61-run victory and qualify for the Super 8 stage.

Death of a rivalry: Has India vs Pakistan lost its magic due to overexposure?T20 World Cup: Cricket's greatest rivalry has become its most overplayed fixture. The guaranteed group-stage meetings are killing the magic, stifling emerging teams, and turning spectacle into monotony.

Devdutt Padikkal puts selectors on alert with maiden double ton vs UttarakhandDevdutt Padikkal put India selectors on alert with his maiden first-class double century in the Ranji Trophy semi-final against Uttarakhand. The Karnataka captain's 232-run knock strengthened his case for a Test recall.

Steve Smith replaces Josh Hazlewood in Australia squad ahead of Sri Lanka clashSteve Smith has been named as a replacement for injured Josh Hazlewood in the Australia squad for the T20 World Cup 2026. His inclusion will strengthen Australia's batting as they prepare to face Sri Lanka in a crucial fixture.

Unable to digest defeat, Mohsin Naqvi leaves stadium midway through chaseAs Pakistan's middle-order collapsed against India in Colombo, Mohsin Naqvi decided to leave the stadium mid-way through the chase. India dominated Pakistan to secure a thumping 61-run win on Sunday, February 15.

Ex-Pakistan spinner mocks IND vs PAK Colombo rout: Boycott was betterT20 World Cup: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria mocked Pakistan's humiliating 61-run loss to India in Colombo. Kaneria suggested a boycott would have been less embarrassing as Pakistan's Super 8 hopes now hang by a thread.

AFG vs UAE Highlights: Afghanistan beat UAE by 5 wickets to stay in Super 8s raceAfghanistan (AFG) vs UAE (UAE), T20 World Cup Highlights: Afghanistan have kept their Super 8s dreams alive by beating UAE by 5 wickets in what turned out to be a thriller in New Delhi. Azmatullah Omarzai's all-round brilliance has given Afghanistan a glimmer of hope.

Like Kohli in Melbourne, Ishan Kishan finds cricket's loneliest place in ColomboT20 World Cup 2026: In Colombo against Pakistan, Ishan Kishan found cricket's loneliest place, the same space Virat Kohli once inhabited in Melbourne, but reached it through dominance rather than endurance.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
